comments:
If you terminate a java program that you are debugging, Eclipse
seems to leave behind a zombie of that java program. The log file
said it can terminate it. 

The problem is, it seems to leave behind zombie even if I run
the program in the debugger till the end, and the program should
be exited normally. 

After a while, I have about 10 java zombies, this is unbelievable.

Below is the content of the log file:

What VM (vendor & version) are you debugging your programs with? There is a 
known problem with terminating a suspended IBM1.3.1 VM on Linux - see bug 27043.

What version and vendor of VM?
The log file said it all!!!

The VM you use to run the Eclipse IDE is not neccessarily the same VM you use 
to run/debug programs under development in Eclipse.

There's only one single VM on my computer. Besides, even if you have multiple
VMs, it's fairly simple to control which VM to use through PATH and CLASSPATH on
Linux.

Unless Eclipse comes with a special VM just for the debugger (which would be
news to me), I don't see how the Eclipse debugger can run in another VM than the
one and only one VM I have on the computer. 

Please enlighten me!

You can install any number of VMs on your computer. You can point Eclipse to 
them through the VM preference page: Java -> Installed JREs. You can build, 
run, and debug projects against different VMs/System Libraries.

I don't recall seeing problems with the Sun 1.4.2 around termination before. 
Chen, can you provide a test case? Something that we can debug which doesn't 
terminate correctly for you?

I'm now running JDK 1.4.2, with Eclipse-linux-GTK 3.0M2. I can't get
the same problem anymore. The problem happened when I was using 
JDK 1.4.2Beta with 3.0M1.

The scenario was like this:
 - Start debugging a pretty large plugin (I'm not sure if the size of 
the plugin has anything to do, probably not. Normally, I rarely use
debugger. But that time, I ran into a nasty problem so I had to 
rely on the debugger to solve it)
 - Step through it a little bit
 - Terminate the debugging process *before* the plugin is completely
loaded

I ran into this zombie issue because my plugin had problem before 
it's finished loading. And a couple of times, I terminate the 
debugger right before the problem showed up, which is before
the plugin is done loading.

Sorry that I can't provide the problematic source code for that :)
Sounds like a VM defect. Closing.
